text:
Well it does kinda the same mistakes like Castlevania: Lords of Shadow.
1. Trys to be something else (Zelda)
2. Doesn't really got much to do with Starfox. Actually it's based on a game for the Nintendo 64 called Dinosaur planet
3. Looks pretty
4. Ignoring 1 and 2, it's actually a decent game.

Much like Castlevania LoS

text: One of the most underrated soundtracks by far. The folks at Rare have done another fantastic job! It is a bit of a shame that the game turned out as Starfox Adventures opposed to Dinosaur Planet, but still, even with the moments that made this game stick out too much (Arwing fights basically. Without them I would have been perfectly content with this title one hundred percent.) its fantastic. Darn I need to play this again, at the very least for the scenery porn.

author: Brian Scalabrine aka GOAT

text: @XxGonixXFAN SMB was my very first video game, and I grew up with a NES and Genesis, I'm not new to video games. Believe it or not, it is possible for someone to like both new and old games. I don't think Nintendo has ever really lost its charm. In my eyes, they never fail to deliver.
author: minty

text: @Kirbychu1 Super Mario Galaxy, a lot of new comers to mario liked it but the older generation of mario lovers who first played mario when it just came out didn't like it. I can tell you are one of the new comers, a kid, that likes these old games. If you could go back in time and played the games I played, than you would disagree with yourself
author: Brian Scalabrine aka GOAT

text:
@XxGonixXFAN 
I disagree. Even though many companies turn to guns and violence to real in the big bucks, Nintendo has always stay trued to its fans and delivered both excellent and creative games. Kirby's Epic Yarn, Super Mario Galaxy 2, and Donkey Kong Country Returns would all like to have a word with you. Those are just the recent ones too.
